body.p: Attorney-at-Law who included among his clients the Verein zur Speisung und Bekleidung hungernder Kinder in Wien (Association for the Feeding and Clothing of Hungry Schoolchildren in Vienna). His chancelry was located at Vienna I, Mahlerstraße (formerly Maximilianstraße) 14.

div.head: Lamberg and Schenker
div.p: Schenker had dealings with Ernst Lamberg throughout the period November 1922 to December 1924. These concerned the bequests made to Schenker in the will of his long-standing piano pupil, Mrs Sofie Deutsch, whose death occurred on January 5, 1917, and whose will took some time to prove. Lamberg was first in contact with Schenker on November 20 and 21, 1922, when there was a dispute between the Figdor family and the Verein on the one hand, and artists (including Schenker) on the other, as to apportionment of funds. Then in late 1923 and 1924, when the Verein disbanded, Lamberg oversaw the allocation and transfer of funds for the Sofie Deutsch stipends for impecunious talented composers, on which Schenker was the sole adjudicator, to the Akademie für Musik und darstellende Kunst.

div.head: Correspondence
div.p: There are five letters from Lamberg to Schenker (OJ 12/31, [1]‒[3], UMdK 312 D/1924, [3], and OJ 12/31, [3], and one from Schenker to Lamberg (OJ 5/24, [1]). There are at least twelve relevant diary entries and occasional references in other correspondence.
